item.title: 調査：アマゾンやネットフリックスが大胆な映画に手を引く中、モディ政権与党BJPの圧力によりインドのストリーミング業界には自己検閲が蔓延している（ワシントン・ポスト紙）
item.description:
Washington Post:
Investigation: as Amazon and Netflix back down on daring films, self-censorship pervades the Indian streaming industry due to pressure from Modi's ruling BJP  —  MUMBAI — Over a three-decade career, the filmmaker Anurag Kashyap often trained a critical eye on his native India as he wove tales …

item.title: シーズン中にポッドキャストを主催し始めたNFL選手が急増中。個性を抑圧しがちなリーグでは意外な展開だ（エマニュエル・モーガン／ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Emmanuel Morgan / New York Times:
A look at the surge of NFL players who have begun hosting podcasts during the season, a surprising development in a league that tends to suppress individuality  —  The N.F.L. tends to suppress individuality, but podcasts from stars like the Kelce brothers, Micah Parsons and Tyreek Hill are popping up as valuable portals to fans.

item.title: ウクライナのメディアはどのように戦争報道のバランスをとっているのか。国営テレビは愛国的で政府寄りの発言をし、ネットでは批判的な報道が盛んだ（Yana Lyushnevskaya/Nieman Reports）
item.description:
Yana Lyushnevskaya / Nieman Reports:
How Ukrainian media is balancing war coverage, with national TV speaking in a highly patriotic, pro-government voice and critical reporting thriving online  —  Yana Lyushnevskaya, NF '24, on the difficult dilemma Ukrainian journalists face when covering war in their own country

item.title: 米国務省がアルス・クルマシェワを不当に拘束されているとし、ロシアからの解放を確保するために米国が取り組むことを約束するキャンペーンについて（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
A look at a campaign for the US State Department to label Alsu Kurmasheva as wrongfully detained, committing the US to work to secure her release from Russia  —  The family and employer of Alsu Kurmasheva, a dual U.S.-Russian citizen, say she has been targeted because she is an American and a journalist

item.title: イーロン・マスクの主張に「困った」テキサス州司法長官、Xの訴えを「軽薄」とするMedia Mattersを調査、Xは第5巡回区への提訴で反SLAPP法を回避（Adi Robertson/The Verge）
item.description:
Adi Robertson / The Verge:
Texas' AG, “troubled” by Elon Musk's claims, probes Media Matters, which calls X's suit “frivolous”; X avoids anti-SLAPP statutes by filing in the 5th Circuit  —  X, formerly Twitter, has followed through with owner Elon Musk's threat to sue the left-leaning nonprofit Media Matters.

item.title: トランプ・メディア＆テクノロジー社、トゥルース・ソーシャル社が7,300万ドルの損失を出したと報じた20のメディアを提訴、15億ドルの損害賠償を要求。
item.description:
Robert Burnson / Bloomberg:
Trump Media & Technology sues 20 media outlets, demanding $1.5B in damages, for reporting that Truth Social lost $73M, calling the number “an utter fabrication”  —  The company behind former President Donald Trump's Truth Social wants $1.5 billion in damages from news organizations …

item.title: 一部の企業の広告が反ユダヤ主義的なコンテンツの隣に表示されたというメディア・マターズの主張は、Xの訴訟での主張とは異なり、「捏造」ではないようだ（Devin Coldewey/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Devin Coldewey / TechCrunch:
Media Matters' claims that some companies' ads appeared next to antisemitic content do not seem to be “manufactured”, contrary to what X alleges in its suit  —  Elon Musk's X, formerly Twitter, has filed a lawsuit alleging defamation by a news organization over claims …

item.title: 急遽集められた全員参加の場で、リンダ・ヤカリーノはメディア・マターズが「物語を強要する」ことで知られていると述べ、スタッフに「可能な限り財政的責任を果たす」よう求めた（Kylie Robison/Fortune）
item.description:
Kylie Robison / Fortune:
At a hastily assembled all-hands, Linda Yaccarino said Media Matters is known “to force a narrative” and asked staff to “be as fiscally responsible as possible”  —  KIRSTY WIGGLESWORTH - WPA POOL/GETTY IMAGES  —  At a Monday all-hands hastily assembled at the last minute at X …

item.title: 情報筋フォックス・ニュース、2016年にセス・リッチ説を否定したグレッグ・ウィルソンを週末編集長としてウェブサイトを監督するため静かに再雇用（Justin Baragona/The Daily Beast紙）
item.description:
Justin Baragona / The Daily Beast:
Sources: Fox News quietly rehires Greg Wilson, who was responsible for the debunked Seth Rich story in 2016, to oversee its website as a weekend managing editor  —  In this week's edition of Confider, we reveal how Fox News has quietly brought back the editor who pulled the trigger on it disastrous, conspiracy-stoking report.

item.title: XがMedia Mattersを名誉毀損で提訴、同メディアがXの反ユダヤ主義的コンテンツの量を「故意に悪意を持って」誤って伝えたと主張（Sharon Knolle/The Wrap）
item.description:
Sharon Knolle / The Wrap:
X files a defamation lawsuit against Media Matters, claiming the outlet “knowingly and maliciously” misrepresented the amount of antisemitic content on X  —  Musk says the watchdog org “would not let truth get in the way of a story”  —  Elon Musk has followed through on his threat …

item.title: エピック対グーグル：グーグル幹部が、ユーザーがスポティファイの支払いシステム経由でサブスクリプションを購入した場合、スポティファイは手数料を支払わず、グーグル経由で支払った場合は4％を支払うことを確認（The Verge）
item.description:
The Verge:
Epic v. Google: a Google exec confirms that Spotify pays no commission when users buy subscriptions via Spotify's payment system and 4% when they pay via Google  —  Music streaming service Spotify struck a seemingly unique and highly generous deal with Google for Android-based payments …

item.title: ラドバイブル・グループは、同ブランドの既存のユニラッド・テック・ソーシャルページを発展させるため、技術系コンテンツの視聴者が前年比187％増加したことを受け、技術系ウェブサイトを立ち上げた（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
LADbible Group launches a tech website to help build on the brand's existing Unilad Tech social pages, after the audience for its tech content grew 187% YoY  —  The launch builds on Unilad Tech's social audience of 18 million followers.  —  Ladbible Group has launched a dedicated tech website …

item.title: ジェフ・ザッカー氏のRedBird IMIがテレグラフ紙とスペクテイター紙の経営権を取得する計画。
item.description:
Press Gazette:
Jeff Zucker's RedBird IMI plans to take control of the Telegraph and Spectator after agreeing to a loan of £600M to repay debts owed by the Barclay family  —  Abu Dhabi-backed investment fund RedBird IMI has said it is set to take control of the Telegraph and Spectator publications …

item.title: リンダ・ヤカリーノは従業員へのメモの中で、Xの広告に関するMedia Mattersの報道は「誤解を招く」ものであり、Xは「欺瞞的な攻撃」と戦っている最中だと述べている（Caitlin Huston/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Caitlin Huston / The Hollywood Reporter:
In a note to employees, Linda Yaccarino says the Media Matters report about ads on X is “misleading” and that X is in the midst of battling “deceptive attacks”  —  In a note to employees, the X CEO said that reports of antisemitic content on the platform come from a “misleading and manipulated article.”

item.title: 大手広告主がXから逃げた後、ベニー・ジョンソン、アンドリュー・テイト、ギャヴィン・マクインズ、バビロン・ビーのような右派メディアやインフルエンサーが広告の購入や寄付を約束（Matt Binder/Mashable）
item.description:
Matt Binder / Mashable:
After big advertisers flee X, right-wing media outlets and influencers pledge to buy ads or donate, like Benny Johnson, Andrew Tate, Gavin McInnes, Babylon Bee  —  So far, they are at least hundreds of millions of dollars short on making up for X's potential lost revenue. … Disney.
